stentry.b: To Create an openrc File and Load Its Variables

ul.li:
On Linux or Mac OS X:
Name the file openrc.sh and add variables to the file. You can obtain the values of the following variables from the Horizon web console. For more information and examples, see OpenStack Variables.
Navigate to the directory that contains the openrc.sh file and run the source openrc.sh command.
When prompted, enter your OpenStack password.
(Optional) To prevent the variables from being discarded when you close your terminal session, add the variables to your ~/.bashrc file and run the source ~/.bashrc command.

On Windows:
Name the file openrc.bat and add variables to the file.
Navigate to the directory that contains the openrc.bat file and run the file.
When prompted, enter your OpenStack password.
(Optional) To prevent the variables from being discarded when you close your terminal session, click Control Panel System Advanced system settings Environment Variables and add the variables to your System variables.

ol.li:
Create a network.You can also use an existing network.
Create and name a network, for example:neutron net-create myNetwork
Create and name a subnet, add a DNS name server to your network, and define an allocation pool, for example:neutron subnet-create --name mySubnet --dns-nameserver ns1.example.com --allocation-pool "start=10.0.0.2,end=10.0.0.254" myNetwork 10.0.0.0/24

Create a router.
Create and name a router, for example:neutron router-create myRouter
Connect your router to the external network (Ext-Net):neutron router-gateway-set myRouter ext-net
Create an interface and associate it with your router and subnet, for example:neutron router-interface-add myRouter mySubnet

Create a key pair and write the key file, for example:nova keypair-add myKeypair > myKeyFile.pemThe pem file contains the RSA private key that you will need to run Terraform commands and to ssh into your cluster.
Determine your network's ID:neutron net-listYou will need the network ID to configure your tfvars file and to run terraform commands.
Ensure that your tenant has at least 16GB of RAM available:nova quota-showA -1 value indicates an unlimited resource quota.
